clinical_indication: Persistent cough for 6 weeks with intermittent hemoptysis. History of 30 pack-year smoking. Evaluate for pulmonary malignancy.

findings.observation: 8mm ground-glass nodule in the posterior segment
3mm solid nodule in the superior segment
findings.comparison: stable compared to prior exam dated 2024-11-15

findings.observation: Subcarinal lymph node measuring 12mm in short axis
Mildly prominent right hilar lymph node

incidental_findings: Coronary artery calcifications noted in the LAD territory
impressions:
1. New 8mm ground-glass nodule in the right upper lobe posterior segment, suspicious for early neoplasm given clinical history. Recommend PET-CT or short-interval follow-up.
2. Enlarging subcarinal lymph node (8mm to 12mm), may represent reactive or neoplastic adenopathy.
3. Stable 3mm left lower lobe solid nodule, likely benite granuloma.
4. Coronary artery calcifications and small hiatal hernia noted incidentally.

scoring.recommendation: 6-month follow-up CT recommended. Consider PET-CT for further evaluation of RUL nodule given clinical risk factors.
